comments:
NoSuchApplicationException when API recording using the IAC.

Using the TPTP-4.4.0-200705080100C driver, the following exception is thrown when trying to record a simple Java application using the API Recorder and the IAC:

org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.local.control.NoSuchApplicationException
	at org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.local.control.ProcessImpl.launch(ProcessImpl.java:189)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.trace.ui.provisional.launcher.PrimaryLaunchDelegate.launchProcess(PrimaryLaunchDelegate.java:428)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.trace.ui.provisional.launcher.PrimaryLaunchDelegate.run(PrimaryLaunchDelegate.java:276)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:803)

This symptom cannot be reproduced using the Agent Controller packaged with the the TPTP-4.4.0-200705080100C driver.

JRE:

Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build pwi32devifx-20070323 (if
ix 117674: SR4 + 116644 + 114941 + 116110 + 114881))
IBM J9 VM (build 2.3, J2RE 1.5.0 IBM J9 2.3 Windows XP x86-32 j9vmwi3223ifx-2007
0323 (JIT enabled)
J9VM - 20070322_12058_lHdSMR
JIT  - 20070109_1805ifx3_r8
GC   - WASIFIX_2007)
JCL  - 20070131

OS:

Windows XP Professional SP2

To reproduce this defect, follow the steps of the 'Record a Java application (Integrated Agent Controller)' test case in the \test-results\test\org.eclipse.tptp.test.tools.api.tests\manual\Recorder\Test.UI.APIRecorder.Windows_IA32.testsuite test suite.

This defect appears to be a timing issue since is does work periodically when debugging a self-hosted instance of Eclipse.  While debugging, I noticed the following exception:

org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.local.control.InactiveProcessException
	at org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.local.control.NodeImpl.killProcess(NodeImpl.java:115)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.local.control.ProcessImpl.kill(ProcessImpl.java:203)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui.internal.util.ProcessAdapter.terminate(ProcessAdapter.java:217)
	at org.eclipse.debug.core.Launch.terminate(Launch.java:229)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchManager.shutdown(LaunchManager.java:2231)
	at org.eclipse.debug.core.DebugPlugin.stop(DebugPlugin.java:571)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleContextImpl$3.run(BundleContextImpl.java:1040)
	at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(AccessController.java:242)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleContextImpl.stop(BundleContextImpl.java:1036)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleHost.stopWorker(BundleHost.java:457)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.AbstractBundle.suspend(AbstractBundle.java:526)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.Framework.suspendBundle(Framework.java:1148)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.StartLevelManager.decFWSL(StartLevelManager.java:675)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.StartLevelManager.doSetStartLevel(StartLevelManager.java:291)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.StartLevelManager.shutdown(StartLevelManager.java:261)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.SystemBundle.suspend(SystemBundle.java:188)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.Framework.shutdown(Framework.java:622)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.Framework.close(Framework.java:525)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.OSGi.close(OSGi.java:41)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.shutdown(EclipseStarter.java:399)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:197)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:64)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:615)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.invokeFramework(Main.java:497)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:436)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:1162)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:1137)
I'm unable to reproduce this on the C driver with IBM JDK 1.5 SR1 and SR4a.  Returning defect as discussed with Paul. Please reopen if you experience this problem on another machine.

This symptom is resolved in the TPTP-4.4.0-200705080100Y driver when using the JRE 1.5 SR4a.  However, using the IBM JRE 1.4.2 SR8, I still get the following exception and the enclosed dialog appears:

org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.local.control.NoSuchApplicationException
at org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.local.control.ProcessImpl.launch(ProcessImpl.java:189)
at org.eclipse.tptp.trace.ui.provisional.launcher.PrimaryLaunchDelegate.launchProcess(PrimaryLaunchDelegate.java:428)
at org.eclipse.tptp.trace.ui.provisional.launcher.PrimaryLaunchDelegate.run(PrimaryLaunchDelegate.java:276)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:570)

I'm unable to reproduce this with IBM JRE 1.4.2 on the C driver.  For the Y driver, I get the following error for both JRE 1.4 and 1.5:

"The java class is not found: APIRecorderProbe_probe$Probe_0"

In any case, this defect doesn't seem to be IAC related.  The exception is coming from the execution framework.  I'm reassigning defect to the owner of the execution framework for further investigation.

I do recommend a couple of different things though:

- See if you can reproduce this problem with the same JRE using the standalone Agent Controller.
- Check under your IAC's configuration file to see if it's properly generated.  The configuration file can be located in:
<eclipse_home>/plugins/org.eclipse.tptp.platform.ac.win_ia32/agent_controller/config/serviceconfig.xml
Hi Paul. Do you have a chance to try out Navid's suggestions? Thanks.
Using the TPTP-4.4.0-200705310943, I cannot reproduce this problem with the AC or IAC.
